article.title: Recent advances in the genome mining of Aspergillus secondary metabolites (covering 2012–2018)
article.abstract: Secondary metabolites (SMs) produced by filamentous fungi possess diverse bioactivities that make them excellent drug candidates.

sections.introduction: Filamentous fungi, including those within the Aspergillus genus, are known to produce a vast array of secondary metabolites (SMs) that exhibit a broad range of biological activities.

article.insights_summary: The review covers advances made in genome mining SMs produced by Aspergillus nidulans, Aspergillus fumigatus, Aspergillus niger, and Aspergillus terreus in the past six years (2012–2018). Genetic identification and molecular characterization of SM biosynthetic gene clusters, along with proposed biosynthetic pathways, will be discussed in depth.
